description: {"blocks":[{"key":"pqa0","text":"A general assay for the preparation of PCR amplicons for further analysis of fungal communities by Illumina amplicon sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nu2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74s62","text":"The primers target the 2nd internal transcribed spacer region (ITS2) of the ribosomal RNA gene and were specifically designed for Illumina amplicon sequencing. The ITS4ngsUni primer was designed by Tedersoo et al. (2016) as a universal primer for nearly all eukaryotes, and the fITS7 primer was designed by Ihrmark et al. (2012) as a fungal-specific primer. The ITS2 region primer pair should capture a higher diversity compared to primers targeting the ITS1 region. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4q3m1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6dp3t","text":"For barcoding, we use the Fludigm Access Array, and therefore, the primers are synthesized with the CS1 and CS2 regions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":20}],"data":{}},{"key":"liru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hlk3","text":"When working with soil samples, we usually obtain amplicons in the range of 300-500bp. Double bands are often observed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BCFB7AF3C1AC11EE85210A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.fluidigm.com/products/access-array"}}}}

groups.title: SoWa RI Anaerobic and Molecular Microbiology (public)

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"50hur","text":"Tedersoo, L. et al. Tree diversity and species identity effects on soil fungi, protists and animals are context dependent. ISME J. 10, 346–362 (2016).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":123,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":131,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8sit","text":"doi:10.1038/ismej.2015.116","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":26}],"data":{}},{"key":"9fftn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmgin","text":"Ihrmark, K. et al. New primers to amplify the fungal ITS2 region - evaluation by 454-sequencing of artificial and natural communities. FEMS Microbiol. Ecol. 82, 666–677 (2012).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":12,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":135,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":157,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85gup","text":"DOI: 10.1111/j.1574-6941.2012.01437.x","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":37}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8DBC5B22108A4896BC9F7A93923D8973","url":"http://doi:10.1038/ismej.2015.116"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"66BBF58EE22D42F89D7A65A8257B2C9F","url":"http://DOI: 10.1111/j.1574-6941.2012.01437.x"}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5s1of","text":"Stain gel for at least   in an Ethidium bromide TAE bath (or any other DNA stain). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ejv1","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2o4o5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"kg4o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":17,"offset":192}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4h374","text":"Ethidium bromide is not regulated as hazardous waste at low concentrations, but is treated as hazardous waste by many organizations. Material should be handled according to the manufacturer's Safety Data Sheet (SDS). ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ctc2c","text":"Most use of ethidium bromide in the laboratory (0.25–1 µg/ml) is below the LD50 dosage, making acute toxicity unlikely. Testing in humans and longer studies in a mammalian system would be required to fully understand the long-term risk ethidium bromide poses to lab workers, but it is clear that ethidium bromide can cause mutations in mammalian and bacterial cells. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"length":9,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4o4vh","text":"Wikipedia","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"CD32977CC1D211EE85210A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Safety_Data_Sheet"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"},"1":{"data":{"guid":"F7A3E5BB8E764B81936F58C27388C24D","url":"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethidium_bromide"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}}}}
